p: Two hundred grams each of the dried leaves of the plants (coarse powder) were brought to boil in 3.5 L of distilled water on a hot plate for about one hour thirty minutes and then strained. The aqueous extracts were filtered using Whatman No. 1 filter paper (Sigma-Aldrich Inc., St. Louis, MO, USA), and subsequently cooled for 45 min. After cooling, the extracts were concentrated using the drying oven with relatively lower heat at 38 °C for 24 h and stored in a refrigerator at 4 °C.
